creator: Jochen.Seifarth@web.de
text:
<script.../> is not undetstood by all browsers I tested (IE 6, Mozilla 1.7.3 and
Forefox 1.0PR, all on Windows) and javascripts are not loaded.

<script...> //</scripts> is OK so I patched some XSLs to work around the problem.

creator: Jochen.Seifarth@web.de
text:
Created attachment 12934
2 pactched XSLs in 1 diff

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
I'd rather do this in the last transformation step.

<xsl:transform match="script">
	<xsl:copy>
		<xsl:apply-templates select="@*|node()" />
		<xsl:if test="not(.//text())"><xsl:text> </xsl:text></xsl:if>
	</xsl:copy>
</xsl:transform>

(see http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-html/2002Feb/0071.html)

Fair comment - as I said my workaround was quick and *dirty*. Will you submit
patch ?
